keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and MATTHEW ROSENBERG

lead_paragraph: In nominating Joseph F. Dunford Jr. of the Marines, the president picked a veteran combat commander to help him wind down one war and figure out how to win another.

headline.print_headline: Joint Chiefs Nominee Is Known to Maneuver Between Disparate Roles
headline.main: Joseph Dunford, Joint Chiefs Nominee, Known to Maneuver Between Roles

snippet: In nominating Joseph F. Dunford Jr. of the Marines, the president picked a veteran combat commander to help him wind down one war and figure out how to win another.
abstract: Profile of Gen Joseph F Dunford Jr of the Marines, veteran combat commander nominated by Pres Obama to lead the Joint Chiefs of Staff.
